plantDetails.description: Oryza sativa, commonly known as Asian cultivated rice, is one of the most widely grown cereal crops globally.
plantDetails.trivia: Rice is a staple food for more than half of the world's population.

plantDetails.description: Zea mays, commonly known as corn or maize, is a major cereal grain first domesticated in southern Mexico.
plantDetails.trivia: Corn is used in a variety of products, including food, fuel, and biodegradable plastics.

plantDetails.description: Solanum lycopersicum, known as tomato, is a widely cultivated fruit used in cooking worldwide.
plantDetails.trivia: Tomatoes were once believed to be poisonous and were called 'poison apples' in the 18th century.

plantDetails.description: Solanum melongena, commonly known as eggplant, is a versatile vegetable used in various cuisines.
plantDetails.trivia: Eggplants are technically berries, not vegetables!

plantDetails.description: Ipomoea aquatica, also known as kangkong or water spinach, is a fast-growing leafy vegetable commonly cultivated in water.
Carica papaya, commonly known as papaya, is a tropical fruit known for its sweet taste and nutritional benefits.
